byline.contributor: Saba Imtiaz reported from Karachi, and Declan Walsh from London. Griff Palmer contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By SABA IMTIAZ and DECLAN WALSH

abstract: Pakistani investigators raid offices of software company Axact in Karachi, which came to attention for operating global diploma mill that made millions of dollars from network of fake online schools; New York Times reported links between company and at least 370 websites.
lead_paragraph: After a report by The New York Times, Pakistan’s interior minister ordered the inquiry into the company and hundreds of school websites linked to it.

headline.main: Pakistani Investigators Raid Offices of Axact, Fake Diploma Company
headline.print_headline: Pakistan Raids Offices of Fake Diploma Company

snippet: After a report by The New York Times, Pakistan’s interior minister ordered the inquiry into the company and hundreds of school websites linked to it.
